  • Project on GitHub

    A list of 205 national and international academic meetings in various disciplines for key features of inclusivity and sustainability and propose solutions to make conferences more modern, effective, equitable and intellectually productive for the research community and environmentally sustainable for our planet.

  • Created by eLife Community Ambassadors

FASEB Family of meetings

Conference year: 2018

Total years: 37

Disciplines: Biology & Biophysics

Gender balance: None

Attendance cost: $2000-$4000

Registration fee: $500-1200

Carbon footprint (tons of CO2): 96000

Other carbon footprint (tons of CO2): 19200

Society name: Federation for Experimental Biology (FASEB is made up of 29 scientific member societies, representing more than 130,000 researchers from around the world)

Society members: 130,000

Attendees: 64,000

Venue: meetings in United States and at international locations

Frequency: Biennial

Sponsors:

Virtual option: None

Digital archives: None

Electronic program dissemination:

On-site maternity: None

On-site childcare: None

Caregiver grant: None

Career development: None

ECR promotion events: None

Travel awards: Yes, Only for women, underrepresented minorities, and junior trainees (The availability of financial support and awards varies by conference and is contingent upon funding. In addition, most SRCs provide Travel, Poster, or Short-Talk Awards. The awards are generally based on the quality of submitted abstracts, poster presentations, or oral presentations and typically range from $250-$1,000.)

Code of conduct: https://secure.faseb.org/src/2018/code-of-conduct.htm

Safety instructions: None

Environmental sustainability: None

Public engagement: None

Sustainability initiatives: None

Other details: 64000 (200 attendees for 320 meetings a year)
